title: About This Whole Toxic Problem
body:
So I've been thinking about making a post like this for a while and it's been hard to keep it clean and not so, how shall I say "ranty". Why does there seem to be such an influx of toxic behavior with little to no recourse? 

Let us take a look at the system as it is. Someone is "toxic", they get reported, they enter the tribunal, and then a decision is made by the player base. Right now we only have the end score and a full chat log. In some cases this is enough to make a judgement. But in a lot of cases, feeding, throwing, and in general making another players experience less than expected is not possible to see. This is a major problem. 

League of Legends has moved from an indy company with a large player base the one of the most played, and dare I say largest online competitive base. We can't continue on the way things are. The tribunal itself has done a fantastic job clearing out a lot of the chat based hate and leaving/disconnection reports. But what it has failed to do is consistently keep the rift an enjoyable place to be. 

League of Legends is a game where you rely on every member of your team to work together to achieve the same goal. If one person disrupts this synergistic necessity it won't only cost a game but in most cases the enjoyment to play the game. 

If we take a look at the ranked environment it's even worse. Most people don't go into champion select with a positive approach most of the time. As players we are at the constant fear of trolls, disconnects, feeders and afk's, on top of the pressure of playing a ranked game in hopes to win and raise yourself in the ranked community. 

We shouldn't have that fear. We should be able to go into a queue, ranked or not, and be confident that we will have a good time. We should be rewarded for our hard work, our effort to win the game and above all else being respectful summoners. 

As it stands now, there's not much loss to a normal game. When you get into ranked however, the balance is disrupted. Rather than being encouraged to play our best as a team, it's more often than not incentivised to play a carry role otherwise you risk losing a game. This is both a fault of the system and as well as the community.

Lets take a look at most of the common issues ranked games tend to have. If you're are within your level of play, you will gain and lose a steady amount of points. 

If you play a really good game, you're not rewarded, whereas if you play a bad game, you're not penalized more either. 

If you play poorly, but your team helps you into winning the game, you are rewarded the exact same as everyone else, even though you were an anchor. Whereas if you play excellently, but you have someone on the team weighing you down and you lose, you are penalized the exact same as everyone else. 

This is not a good system. One players anchor or one players forklift shouldn't determine YOUR outcome. You should be held accountable based on your actions, positive or negative to the team. I'm not saying you shouldn't lose points for a game, but you shouldn't lose points due to someone not connecting and being forced to surrender at 20. As well as you shouldn't be rewarded for winning a game while dragging your team down, purposely or not. 

This is a serious issue as we are consistently met with players either too ahead or behind a current rank, people disconnecting, people not connecting at all, people feeding, throwing and the list goes on. 

An idea that works well with the champion mastery system is checking individual play at the end of the game to determine point gain and loss, and as well as IP gained. If you get a S+ and win a game, you should be rewarded for that. If you get an F (Or whatever the lowest rank possible is) and still win the game, you shouldn't be rewarded as much as the other player who put more effort into getting a better score. This is the same when losing, only the S+ player shouldn't lose as much as the F player.

Not only will this give incentive to improving play but it can insure people reach their respective rank faster, while not falling below their respective rank too quickly due to toxic behaviour. 

Another option is to add incentive towards initiating a report, which then gets seen as appropriate by the tribunal. Too many times have I seen toxic behaviour and after game, people don't even bother to report the player and queue up right away. This will help stop those players from sliding between the system and continuing to ruin everyone else's experience. 

This is just my two cents on the league community as well and the system in place to stop toxic behaviour. I honestly do believe we should be rewarded more than we currently are for being respectful players. The honor system doesn't count. I haven't seen anyone with icons consistently since the realease of it. We also need a better system in place to make sure toxic players improve their behavior, or at least a system that doesn't put good players at a disadvantage because of toxic play.

replies.body: but rewarding people who get better grades = more "kill steals" = more "reasons to be toxic" = more salty toxic people.
In that case a look into damage done to champions as opposed to actual kills would work far better.
It has to me a mix, otherwise those AoE Mages always come out on top, regardless of if any kills or objectives come from their poke.

The fact that they are applying pressure is part of the concept. Obviously AoE champions are going to have more overall damage to champions at first glance, but that doesn't mean they are always going to be on top. Most of the time the single target hard hitters are the top percentage of kills, while the AoE types are what get them there. Everyone plays a part on the team as a whole.

The idea behind a lot of Riot's decisions are that we will have great games and bad games due to whatever circumstances and over time they should be remotely even.

It'd be impossible for an automated system to accurately determine who played well or badly in a particular match in any way besides wins and losses over time.

For example; a Maokai twisted advances on a jungler going to gank his ADC. He dies for this, but because of that, his ADC escaped and could return to farming faster then if they had died. This is a good play; perhaps not an optimal one, both of them might have escaped somehow, but it's better then the ADC dying or, perhaps, both of them. But this would punish the Maokai for taking that death.
You just succeeded to explain my (and I bet thousands of players') thoughts perfectly. Thank you for this.
Toxic play and pregame is what drives toxic chat.

I don't think your proposed grading system will prevent Single Champ/Single Role players from performing poorly when they don't get the one thing they are good at. In fact, it might help them attain higher ranks than they should possess as an overall player.

Toxicity shouldn't be a problem because we have this thing called a "mute" button.

If you keep crying about "toxic chat" or whatever, you're the problem, because you disabled the chat filter, and you did not mute the "toxic" player. You denied yourself two fucking frontiers of self defense just to get the excuse to cry about how toxic the community is. If you're willing to ban other people over some shit they said in chat, it's time to find another hobby - go to tumblr or something.

I can't believe you people are okay with getting League PATRIOT acts shoved down your throat just so Lyte can keep the evil toxic players away. Keep those shackles coming!

With your logic it's then possible to "mute" a toxic player that feeds and throws a game, magically removing the toxic gameplay. A lot of what this post is about is gameplay, not toxic chat. Although I can't enforce this kind of statement, but please take your arrogance elsewhere as it's not welcomed here.

I think the flexible nature a la champion mastery could be good. I'm not sure how it would pan out as an exact translation though.

Currently the champion mastery system compares you to other players who played that role. Want a sure way to get an S+? Play Xerath ADC, you'll be one of the best Xerath's to ever have ADCed. Needless to say, the system would need to be more general, comparing Xerath ADC to other ADC's, having some feel for how strong certain champions are in the meta, etc.
